        public Map getFullMap(java.lang.String fileName)
        Description copied from interface: IManageMap
        This method is an abstraction for the process of retrieving A Map Object from the Map File to be saved/loaded.
        Specified by:
        getFullMap in interface IManageMap
        Parameters:
        fileName - Fully Qualified Map File Name on local disk. This file will be rendered for Playing as well as for Editing Map.
        Returns:
        Entire Map Object which will be rendered for Playing.
        See Also:
        IManageMap.getFullMap(java.lang.String)

      • writeMapToFile

        private boolean writeMapToFile(Map map,
                               java.lang.String file_name)
        This method is an abstraction for the process of converting A Map Object into the Map File to be saved/loaded.
        Parameters:
        map - This is the entire Map Object which will be converted to a File Object and then written on to a Map File.
        file_name - Name of the Map file to be stored in Resource Folder.
        Returns:
        File write status - True - file written successfully.

      • checkDiscontinuity

        public java.lang.String checkDiscontinuity(Map map)
        Description copied from interface: IManageMap
        This method checks the World Map Object for any discontinuities, i.e. any part(territories/set of territories) that are disconnected from the rest of the connected map.
        Specified by:
        checkDiscontinuity in interface IManageMap
        Parameters:

      • saveMap

        public Map saveMap(Map map,
                   java.lang.String file_name)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IManageMap
        This method receives the World Map Object from GUI and checks it for any discontinuities. If its valid then the map is converted to a FILE Object and forwarded to File Access Layer for saving to a physical MAP File. If its invalid then a boolean value False is returned to GUI.
        Specified by:
        saveMap in interface IManageMap
        Parameters:
        map - GUI Object Representation of the World Map.
        file_name - Name of the Map file to be stored in Resource Folder.
        Returns:
        GUI Map otherwise with a status update for valid or invalid save.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - input/output exception
        See Also:
        IManageMap.saveMap(com.risk.model.gui.Map,String)

      • fetchMap

        public Map fetchMap(java.lang.String file_name)
        Description copied from interface: IManageMap
        This method retrieves an existing World Map File from Resource Folder and returns a MAP Object that can be rendered to UI. If the loaded file is an invalid Map then it returns Null.
        Specified by:
        fetchMap in interface IManageMap
        Parameters:
        file_name - Name of the Map file to be stored in Resource Folder.
        Returns:
        GUI Map object if its a valid map otherwise Null.
        See Also:
        IManageMap.fetchMap(String)

      • guiMapToFile

        private java.lang.String guiMapToFile(Map map,
                                      java.lang.String file_name)
        This method receives the World Map Object from GUI and checks it for any discontinuities. If its valid then the map is converted to a FILE Object and forwarded to File Access Layer for saving to a physical MAP File. If its invalid then a boolean value False is returned to GUI.
        Parameters:
        map - GUI Object Representation of the World Map.
        Returns:
        String Status or Error Message for validations before saving map file.

      • fetchMaps

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> fetchMaps()
        Description copied from interface: IManageMap
        This method retrieves a list of existing World Map File from Resource Folder. User then selects a file from the given list.
        Specified by:
        fetchMaps in interface IManageMap
        Returns:
        List of existing World Map Files from Resource Folder.
        See Also:
        IManageMap.fetchMaps()

      • fileToGuiMap

        private Map fileToGuiMap(java.lang.String file_name)
        This method retrieves an existing World Map File from local system and returns a MAP Object that can be rendered to UI. If the loaded file is an invalid Map then it returns Null.
        Parameters:
        file_name - Absolute Path of the map file stored on local system.
        Returns:
        GUI Map object if its a valid map otherwise Null.

      • findLink

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> findLink(java.lang.String start_node,
                                                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> neighbours_link,
                                                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> territory_visited)
        This recursive method here is an implementation of DepthFirstSearch, which is being run for checking any discontinuity in our Map. Each Territory is assumed to be a node of the graph. Logic is like we start with any territory and do a DepthFirstTraversal of the entire Map. If in the end all the Nodes(Territories) are visited at least once then the graph is connected else not.
        Parameters:
        start_node - : Starting territory for DFS traversal.
        neighbours_link - : Hash Map representing the entire Graph.
        territory_visited - : Marker HashMap to keep track of which all territories are visited.
        Returns:
        HashMap : Resultant HashMap telling which all territories could be visited and which not.

      • convertMapToFile

        private File convertMapToFile(Map map)
        This method parses the Map Object and converts it to a File Object.
        Parameters:
        map - Object Representation of the Map File.
        Returns:
        File file : File Object Representing the Map File to be saved/loaded.
